title: Drawing, "Squared Overlay for the Project "Faces"", ca. 1974
medium: Graphite, red color pencil, brush and blue ink on tracing paper
inscribed: Inscribed in red color pencil in upper right margin:  use print/for mountain/across [double "s" underlined] warp/for portrait with warp; 40" for portrait/leave 4[?] for/brocade/w./twill follow/mountain pattern/thread on /6...for/twill./[upward arrow] warp/45" for hang./plus tie on/length; in lower right margin: print/on/5" fringe; in graphite in lower right margin: [a square with arrow pointing under square to: 2 1/4"; in graphite, squares are numbered in upper and left margins: 2.5 [to] 40.
provenance: Eric Elsesser, California; 1993: acquired by Museum
creditline: Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives
description: Squaring lines within grapite border, with squares marked off every 2 1/2 inches (2.5 to 40) along upper edge and in left margin.  A wiggly blue line runs vertically three-quarters of the way from lower edge.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Squared Overlay for the Project "Faces"", ca. 1974. Graphite, red color pencil, brush and blue ink on tracing paper. Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives. 1993-121-110.
